titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York State National Guard, 32nd Infantry Regiment vouchers 1977.616
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:16:47 +0000.

did.unittitle: New York State National Guard, 32nd Infantry Regiment vouchers

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: New York (State). National Guard. Infantry Regiment, 32nd

did.abstract: This collection consists of vouchers issued by the 32nd Infantry Regiment of the New York State National Guard to deliver helmets and fatigue caps from J.C.F. Deecken of New York City to various members. The documents are dated 1877. The 32nd Regiment was headquartered in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York State National Guard, 32nd Infantry Regiment vouchers, 1977.616, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.
